lines.text: You can show me how to build model airplanes, I'll show you how to pick a lock.

It's hard to hate you, Nelson. You have just enough logic to give your sickness respectability. You've sentenced whole races of people to be born losers, and as the father of one, I object. Not that he was born with two strikes on him, but that you won't give him a third pitch to swing at. Goodbye, Nelson.
You walk out this time, Walter, and I'll destroy you. When I'm through with you, you'll think shoveling horseshit is a step up.
I'm Jewish, my son is Black and my lawyer smokes pot. Don't tell me I'm not in trouble.
Hey, it makes me feel better, and does not affect my judgement. I delivered the valedictorian speech at Harvard... completely stoned.
"All Power to the People"? They had it once. It was called the Stone Age.
I'll shovel it. I'll live in it. But I won't take it.
Now, it wasn't easy for me to get you in here, Mr Charley. I mean, they weren't too happy about having a White person in the building. You're here on a trial basis.
I don't mind living in Watts, but do we have to live in the poor section?
Have you ever been arrested?
That's an offensive question, Mary Ann.
Yes, little sister, I've been busted by the pigs.
Walter, you were like a son to me. But as you well know, having a son can turn out to be a bitter disappointment.

[Roger sings "We Shall Overcome"]
Will you stop singing that song?
Mr. Charley? I got a feeling you better start learning the words.
Roger, we're having chicken for dinner.
I just love chicken, ma'am.
I know you do.
How much did you pay for this car?
14 dollars and a record player.
You were robbed!
God is white. It's simple logic. His son is white.
That's not proof. I'm white. My son is black.
Why is it that ones who always bring up the past are those who never lived in it?
When you're shoveling manure you really fund out which way the wind is blowing.
